intro: Archidendropsis, commonly known as the African snowbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plants are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. They are often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils. Archidendropsis species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
